title: Ericsson's sustainable waste management business venture - Sustainability Magazine
summary: Ericsson is addressing the global waste crisis through its Connected Recycling (ECR) platform, which digitalizes and connects the reverse supply chain to reduce landfill waste and promote circularity. The ECR aims to empower retailers to comply with regulations, generate new revenue streams, and strive for zero waste. By enhancing transparency and traceability in recycling efforts, ECR offers transformative solutions for identifying bottlenecks and creating new monetization opportunities. The article emphasizes the importance of digitalization and innovative waste management approaches in achieving sustainability and net-zero objectives.
green_innovation: TRUE - This is a green innovation because the ECR platform reduces landfill waste, promotes circular economy principles, and enhances environmental sustainability by conserving resources and minimizing emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE - This represents business innovation as the ECR platform is a new technological solution that significantly differs from previous methods of waste management and recycling.
green_product: FALSE - The article discusses a process (ECR) rather than a specific product that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - ECR is a green process as it employs digitalization to optimize recycling and waste management, thereby minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541511 - Custom Computer Programming Services, 541512 - Computer Systems Design Services, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 921120 - Municipal Housing Authorities.
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not indicate greenwashing, as it provides a clear and substantiated explanation of Ericsson's initiatives to promote sustainability and reduce waste, without making misleading claims.

title: Waste is a design flaw: How ReBorn is turning plastic waste into homewares | Virgin - Virgin
summary: ReBorn is a start-up focused on transforming the homeware industry by converting industrial waste into functional products while promoting circular design and sustainability. The founder, Brian Walmsley, aims to address the issues of waste in the industry, which heavily relies on virgin materials and has significant negative environmental impacts. Through partnerships with sustainable waste management companies and a design team dedicated to circular solutions, ReBorn offers products that are fully recyclable, reusable, and repairable, while emitting 79% less carbon than imported alternatives. The brand is expanding its market presence and is supported by Virgin StartUp's accelerator program.
green_innovation: TRUE, because ReBorn's approach significantly reduces environmental impact through the innovative use of industrial waste in creating homeware products and promotes sustainability through circular design.
business_innovation: TRUE, as ReBorn introduces a new and improved business model focused on sustainability and circularity that differs significantly from traditional homeware manufacturing processes.
green_product: TRUE, as the products created by ReBorn are designed to minimize environmental impact, are made from recycled materials, and are fully recyclable, reusable, and repairable.
green_process: TRUE, because ReBorn employs a manufacturing process that focuses on using recycled materials, reducing waste, and promoting sustainability through circular design principles.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 326199 - All Other Plastic Product Manufacturing; 423220 - Home Furnishings Merchant Wholesalers; 331999 - All Other Miscellaneous Nonmetallic Mineral Product Manufacturing; 812310 - Coin-Operated Laundries and Drycleaners.
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article clearly highlights ReBorn's commitment to sustainability, transparency in sourcing materials, and their focus on reducing environmental impact, without making misleading claims about their products.

title: An overview of solid waste management and privatization in kingdom of Bahrain - Frontiers

title: ESGL Holdings Limited (NASDAQ: ESGL) Announces Multi-Year Contract Renewal with Singapore Refining Company ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: Environmental Solutions Group Holdings Limited (ESGL) announced a multi-year contract renewal with Singapore Refining Company (SRC) to provide used catalyst waste disposal services until December 31, 2025. This renewal emphasizes ESGL's commitment to sustainable waste management and collaboration with the petrochemical industry for circular economy solutions. Mr. Quek highlighted the importance of SRC as a partner in achieving long-term sustainability goals. ESGL focuses on innovative technologies to preserve the environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, because ESGL's services involve the disposal of used catalyst waste, which supports the circular economy and aims to minimize environmental impact by transforming industrial waste into sustainable products.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the renewal of a new or improved service for the disposal of used catalysts represents a significant innovation in ESGL's existing operations, enhancing their business processes.
green_product: FALSE, because there is no specific green product mentioned; the focus is on a service related to waste disposal.
green_process: TRUE, because the method of disposing of used catalysts involves environmentally sustainable practices that aim to reduce waste and enhance resource recovery.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562211 - Hazardous Waste Treatment and Disposal; 562212 - Solid Waste Landfill; 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities; 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services.
greenwashing: FALSE, because there is no indication in the article that ESGL is making misleading claims about the environmental benefits of its services; the contract renewal and collaboration with SRC reflect genuine efforts in sustainable practices.

title: Nestlé celebrates five years of its Nestlé Product Technology Center in the USA - Dairy News
summary: Nestlé Health Science celebrates the fifth anniversary of its Product Technology Center in Bridgewater, NJ, which focuses on nutrition and sustainability innovations. The center has played a crucial role in launching new products and improving healthcare management through scientific advancements and sustainable practices. Key achievements include receiving TRUE Gold Level certification and a collaborative initiative on longevity and healthy aging. The company aims to continue driving innovation by focusing on areas like artificial intelligence and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the company is committed to sustainability through waste reduction, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, sourcing ingredients with minimal environmental impact, and making packaging recyclable.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses the introduction of innovative products and processes by Nestlé Health Science, which represents a significant improvement in their product offerings.
green_product: FALSE, because while the article mentions various innovative health solutions, it does not specify any product that meets the comprehensive definition of a green product focused on reducing environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, since the article highlights sustainable management practices, waste reduction efforts, and the use of pilot plants to facilitate environmentally-friendly product development.
